title: GATES ORB / communistquest
description: Rhetoric smells a communist around here. Part of the Communist Dream Quest

dialogueTree.title: Rhetoric: "There it is again! There's a spectr..."
dialogueTree.english: There it is again! There's a spectral smell haunting this industrial harbour. And it smells like...
dialogueTree.polish: Znowu jest! Ten port nawiedza jakiś upiorny zapach. Czuć tu...
dialogueTree.belarusian: Зноў ён тут! Гэты порт праследуе нейкі жудасны пах. Адчуваецца тут...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Heavy fuel oil, mostly. Because it'..."
links.english: Heavy fuel oil, mostly. Because it's an industrial harbour.
links.polish: Głównie ciężkim olejem napędowym. W końcu to port przemysłowy.
links.belarusian: У асноўным цяжкім дызельным палівам. Урэшце рэшт, гэта прамысловы порт.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Years of turmoil, of hopes and drea..."
links.english: Years of turmoil, of hopes and dreams ground beneath the inexorable tides of capital.
links.polish: Lata niepokojów, nadziei i marzeń obróconych w proch uderzeniami niezmordowanych fal kapitału.
links.belarusian: Гады занепакоенасці, надзеі і мараў, разбітых у пыл ударамі нястомных хваляў капіталу.

links.title: You: "(Close your eyes and take a deep br..."
links.english: (Close your eyes and take a deep breath.)
links.polish: (Zamknij oczy i weź głęboki oddech).
links.belarusian: (Закрый вочы і зрабі глыбокі ўдых).

links.title: You: "I *still* don't smell anything."
links.english: I *still* don't smell anything.
links.polish: *Nadal* nic nie czuję.
links.belarusian: *Яшчэ* нічога не адчуваю.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Nonsense. The reek of communism is..."
links.english: Nonsense. The reek of communism is unmistakable, and it's coming... from that railing over there!
links.polish: Bzdura. Smrodu komunizmu nie da się pomylić z niczym innym. I dobiega on... z tamtej balustrady!
links.belarusian: Дурня. Смурод камунізму не пераблытаеш ні з чым іншым. І ён даносіцца... з той балюстрады!

links.title: You: "I can *kind of* smell dreams being..."
links.english: I can *kind of* smell dreams being ground down by capital.
links.polish: Czuję *odrobinę* zapach marzeń ścieranych na proch przez kapitał.
links.belarusian: Адчуваю *крыху* пах мрояў, якія сціраюцца ў пыл капіталам.

links.title: You: "Smell what?"
links.english: Smell what?
links.polish: Ale co?
links.belarusian: Але што?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Can you not detect that inimitable..."
links.english: Can you not detect that inimitable *whiff* of dissatisfaction and restlessness, that sense that the world is in need of dramatic, even *violent* re-ordering?
links.polish: Naprawdę nie wyczuwasz tego niemożliwego do podrobienia *aromatu* niezadowolenia i niepokoju? Poczucia, że świat potrzebuje dramatycznej, *brutalnej* wręcz zmiany w swoim porządku?
links.belarusian: На самой справе не адчуваеш таго немагчымага для падробкі *водару* незадаволенасці і неспакою? Адчування, што свету патрэбна драматычная, *брутальная* нават, змена ў сваім парадку?

links.title: You: "(Close your eyes and take a deep br..."
links.english: (Close your eyes and take a deep breath.)
links.polish: (Zamknij oczy i weź głęboki oddech).
links.belarusian: (Заплюшчы вочы і зрабі глыбокі ўдых).

links.title: Rhetoric: "Can you smell it now?"
links.english: Can you smell it now?
links.polish: Teraz już czujesz?
links.belarusian: Цяпер ужо адчуваеш?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "You inhale. The cilia along your ol..."
links.english: You inhale. The cilia along your olfactory epithelium tingle with excitement as they sift through the swirling morass of industrial odours...
links.polish: Bierzesz wdech. Rzęski na twojej tkance nabłonkowej nosa drżą z ekscytacji, racząc się wirującą mieszaniną przemysłowych zapachów...
links.belarusian: Ты робіш удых. Рэзы на тваёй эпітэліяльнай тканцы носа дрыжаць ад хвалявання, захапляючыся віруючай сумессю прамысловых пахаў...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "First come the smells of the agitat..."
links.english: First come the smells of the agitated strikebreakers, layers of body oil and sweat, over-buttered meals pulled from bakelite lunch pails, the biting stench of lye soap. And then there's the slowly oxidizing metal gates, the scent of stale grease emanating from every crack...
links.polish: Pierwszy dociera do ciebie zapach podnieconych łamistrajków – potu i ludzkiego łoju, zbyt tłustych posiłków wyciągniętych z bakelitowych pudełek śniadaniowych, gryzący odór ługowego mydła. Później pojawia się aromat powoli utleniającej się metalowej bramy i zastałego smaru, jakiego pełne są wszystkie jej szczeliny...
links.belarusian: Першы даходзіць да цябе пах узрушаных ламастрайкаў – поту і чалавечага тлушчу, занадта тоўстых страў, выцягнутых з бакелітавых сняданкавых скрыняў, рэзкі пах шчолачнага мыла. Пазней з'яўляецца пах павольна акісляльнайся металічнай брамы і застаялагася змазкі, якой поўныя ўсе яе шчыліны...

Alternate1.english: Even though the strikebreakers have departed for the night, their smell lingers, layers of body oil and sweat, over-buttered meals pulled from bakelite lunch pails, the biting stench of lye soap. And then there's the slowly oxidizing metal gates, the scent of stale grease emanating from every crack...
Alternate1.polish: Choć łamistrajki śpią już w swoich domach, w powietrzu wciąż czuć ich zapach – potu i ludzkiego łoju, zbyt tłustych posiłków wyciągniętych z bakelitowych pudełek śniadaniowych, gryzący odór ługowego mydła. Później pojawia się aromat powoli utleniającej się metalowej bramy i zastałego smaru, jakiego pełne są wszystkie jej szczeliny...
Alternate1.belarusian: Хоць страйкалам ужо спіцца ў сваіх дамах, у паветры ўсё яшчэ адчуваецца іх пах – поту і чалавечага сала, занадта тлустых страў, вынятых з бакелітных сняданкавых скрынь, рэзкі пах лужнага мыла. Потым з'яўляецца водар павольна акісляльнайся металічнай брамы і застаялых змазак, якімі поўныя ўсе яе шчыліны...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Still smelling for communists, det..."
links.english: "Still smelling for communists, detective?"
links.polish: „Wciąż węszysz za komunistami, detektywie?”
links.belarusian: "Усё яшчэ вынюхваеш камуністаў, дэтэктыве?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, I'll be over here when you'v..."
links.english: "Well, I'll be over here when you've finished." The lieutenant nudges something on the ground with his foot.
links.polish: „Dobrze, poczekam tutaj, aż skończysz” – mówi porucznik, trącając czubkiem buta coś leżącego na ziemi.
links.belarusian: "Добра, я пачакаю тут, пакуль ты скончыш", — сказаў лейтэнант, дакранаючыся насокам бота да чагосьці, што ляжала на зямлі.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "His impatience is feigned. He's cur..."
links.english: His impatience is feigned. He's curious to see how this *personal errand* shakes out.
links.polish: To udawana niecierpliwość. Jest ciekaw, jak się ta twoja *sprawa osobista* zakończy.
links.belarusian: Гэта ўдаваная нецярплівасць. Ён цікавіцца, як скончыцца гэтая твая *асабістая справа*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He'll tolerate this *personal erran..."
links.english: He'll tolerate this *personal errand*, but his patience is wearing thin.
links.polish: Toleruje twoją *sprawę osobistą*, ale jego cierpliwość jest na wyczerpaniu.
links.belarusian: Цярплю тваю *асабістую справу*, але яго цярплівасць на зыходзе.

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.english: "No."
links.polish: „Nie”.
links.belarusian: "Не".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Uh huh.""
links.english: "Uh huh."
links.polish: „Mhm”.
links.belarusian: "Мгм".

links.title: Drama: "The lieutenant issss not persuaded,..."
links.english: The lieutenant issss not persuaded, sssssire.
links.polish: Porucznik nie jesssst przekonany, ssssszanowny panie.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант не перакананы, шаноўны пане.

links.title: Rhetoric: "What the lieutenant thinks is irrel..."
links.english: What the lieutenant thinks is irrelevant. Your politico-olfactory cortex is lighting up like a holiday display. Look, it's pointing you right... to that railing over there!
links.polish: To, co myśli porucznik, jest bez znaczenia. Twoja kora polityczno-węchowa rozpędziła się niczym lokomotywa. I kieruje cię prosto... do tamtej balustrady!
links.belarusian: Тое, што думае лейтэнант, не мае значэння. Твая палітычна-нюхавая кара разганялася як паравоз. І накіроўвае цябе прама... да той балюстрады!

links.title: You: ""What makes you say that?""
links.english: "What makes you say that?"
links.polish: „Czemu tak mówisz?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму ты так кажаш?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No offence, detective, but you're..."
links.english: "No offence, detective, but you're not particularly *subtle*."
links.polish: „Bez urazy, detektywie, ale nie jesteś szczególnie *subtelny*”.
links.belarusian: "Без крыўды, дэтэктыў, але вы не асабліва *тонкі*".

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The lieutenant's right. It's sort o..."
links.english: The lieutenant's right. It's sort of amazing how un-subtly you're sniffing the air around you, almost like you're *trying* to call attention to yourself.
links.polish: Porucznik ma rację. To aż niesamowite, jak niesubtelnie węszysz wokół. Jakbyś nieomal *próbował* ściągnąć na siebie uwagę.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант мае рацыю. Гэта да таго дзіўна, як няўклюдна ты вынюхваеш вакол. Нібыта ты амаль *спрабаваў* прыцягнуць да сябе ўвагу.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything in order, detective?" T..."
links.english: "Everything in order, detective?" The lieutenant gives you a quizzical look.
links.polish: „Wszystko w porządku, detektywie?” – porucznik spogląda na ciebie ze zdziwieniem.
links.belarusian: "Усё ў парадку, дэтэктыў?" — лейтэнант паглядае на вас з здзіўленнем.

links.title: You: ""It's kind of a personal errand.""
links.english: "It's kind of a personal errand."
links.polish: „To taka dość osobista sprawa”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта такая даволі асабістая справа".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A *personal errand*.""
links.english: "A *personal errand*."
links.polish: „*Sprawa osobista*”.
links.belarusian: "*Асабістая справа*".

links.title: You: ""I'm smelling for communists, Kim.""
links.english: "I'm smelling for communists, Kim."
links.polish: „Węszę za komunistami, Kim”.
links.belarusian: "Я вынюхваю камуністаў, Кім".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're smelling for...""
links.english: "You're smelling for..."
links.polish: „Węszysz za...”
links.belarusian: "Вынюхваеш за..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know what? I'll just leave you..."
links.english: "You know what? I'll just leave you to it. Carry on, detective."
links.polish: „Wiesz co? Rób sobie, co chcesz, detektywie. Nie przeszkadzaj sobie”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаеш што? Рабі сабе, што хочаш, дэтэктыў. Не перашкаджай сабе".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It is a mark of the lieutenant's re..."
links.english: It is a mark of the lieutenant's respect for you that he does not press you on this decidedly *extra-curricular* errand.
links.polish: Fakt, że porucznik nie naciska cię w sprawie tych zdecydowanie *pozazawodowych* działań, świadczy o jego szacunku dla ciebie.
links.belarusian: Той факт, што лейтэнант не цісне на цябе ў справе гэтых відавочна *паза-службовых* дзеянняў, сведчыць аб яго павазе да цябе.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm struggling to see the connecti..."
links.english: "I'm struggling to see the connection with our investigation, but I'm sure *all will be revealed* in time."
links.polish: „Nie umiem dostrzec, jak wiąże się to z naszym śledztwem, ale nie wątpię, że *wszystko się z czasem ujawni*”.
links.belarusian: "Не ўмею заўважыць, як гэта звязана з нашым расследаваннем, але не сумняваюся, што *ўсё з часам раскрыецца*".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Nota bene: The lieutenant is not at..."
links.english: Nota bene: The lieutenant is not at all convinced that anything will be revealed.
links.polish: Tak naprawdę porucznik wcale nie jest przekonany, że cokolwiek zostanie ujawnione.
links.belarusian: На самай справе лейтэнант зусім не ўпэўнены, што хоць нешта будзе раскрыта.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In the interest of our investigati..."
links.english: "In the interest of our investigation, I suggest you focus on the case at hand. You can pursue your *political projects* after hours."
links.polish: „Z uwagi na nasze śledztwo radziłbym ci skupić się na naszym zadaniu. Swoje *polityczne projekty* możesz realizować po godzinach pracy”.
links.belarusian: "З увагі на наша расследаванне раіў бы табе засяродзіцца на нашай задачы. Свае *палітычныя праекты* можаш рэалізоўваць пасля працоўных гадзін".

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant is not pleased with..."
links.english: The lieutenant is not pleased with this turn of events, but it's unlikely that he'll move to intervene to stop them.
links.polish: Porucznik nie jest zadowolony z takiego obrotu spraw, wątpliwe jednak, aby interweniował.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант не задаволены такі станам спраў, аднак сумніўна, каб ён умяшываўся.

links.title: Rhetoric: "The lieutenant lacks your *highly d..."
links.english: The lieutenant lacks your *highly developed* politico-olfactory cortex. The reek of communism is undeniable. And it's coming... from that railing right there!
links.polish: Porucznik nie posiada twojej *wysoce rozwiniętej* kory polityczno-węchowej. Smród komunizmu jest ewidentny. I dobiega on... z tamtej balustrady!
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант не валодае тваёй *высокаразвітай* карой палітычна-нюхавой. Смурод камунізму відавочны. І ён даходзіць... з той балюстрады!

links.title: You: ""I'm working on developing my polit..."
links.english: "I'm working on developing my political consciousness."
links.polish: „Pracuję nad rozwijaniem swojej politycznej świadomości”.
links.belarusian: "Я працую над развіццём сваёй палітычнай свядомасці".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're developing your...""
links.english: "You're developing your..."
links.polish: „Rozwijasz swoją...”
links.belarusian: "Развіваеш сваю..."

links.title: You: ""Just taking in the fresh air, like..."
links.english: "Just taking in the fresh air, like a normal detective."
links.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
links.belarusian: "Я радуюся свежаму паветру, як і кожны нармальны дэтэктыў".

Alternate1.english: "Just taking in the morning air, like a normal detective."
Alternate1.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym porannym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
Alternate1.belarusian: "Я радуюся свежым ранішнім паветрам, як любы нармальны дэтэктыў".

Alternate2.english: "Just taking in the afternoon air, like a normal detective."
Alternate2.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym popołudniowym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
Alternate2.belarusian: "Радуюся свежым пасляабедзенным паветрам, як і кожны нармальны дэтэктыў".

Alternate3.english: "Just taking in the evening air, like a normal detective."
Alternate3.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym wieczornym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
Alternate3.belarusian: "Я атрымліваю асалоду ад свежага вечаровага паветра, як і кожны нармальны дэтэктыў".

Alternate4.english: "Just taking in the night air, like a normal detective."
Alternate4.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym nocnym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
Alternate4.belarusian: "Я радуюся свежым начным паветрам, як кожны нармальны дэтэктыў".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's a lot to take in, isn't th..."
links.english: "There's a lot to take in, isn't there?" The lieutenant wrinkles his nose.
links.polish: „Dużo tu powodów do radości, co?” – mówi porucznik, marszcząc nos.
links.belarusian: "Шмат тут прычын для радасці, ці не так?" — кажа лейтэнант, моршчыўшы нос.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "In a word, exactly what you would e..."
links.english: In a word, exactly what you would expect to find at any harbour in the industrialized world...
links.polish: Słowem – czujesz dokładnie to, czego spodziewałbyś się w każdym porcie uprzemysłowionego świata...
links.belarusian: Адным словам, ты адчуваеш дакладна тое, што чакаеш у кожным порце ў прамысловым свеце...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "No, actually. In fact, you can't sm..."
links.english: No, actually. In fact, you can't smell much of *anything*. Perhaps your allergies are acting up?
links.polish: Tak naprawdę to nie. W gruncie rzeczy, to nie czujesz za bardzo *niczego*. Może alergia ci się odzywa?
links.belarusian: Сапраўды, не. Па сутнасці, ты асабліва нічога не адчуваеш. Магчыма, у цябе алергія абвастраецца?

links.title: You: "Does that mean there's a communist..."
links.english: Does that mean there's a communist nearby?
links.polish: Czy to oznacza, że w pobliżu jest komunista?
links.belarusian: Ці азначае гэта, што паблізу ёсць камуніст?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Undoubtedly. And the scent is comin..."
links.english: Undoubtedly. And the scent is coming... from that railing over there!
links.polish: Bez wątpienia. A zapach dociera... z tamtej balustrady!
links.belarusian: Без сумнення. А водар дасягае... з той балюстрады!

links.title: You: "You mean from Mañana?"
links.english: You mean from Mañana?
links.polish: Znaczy się, od Mañany?
links.belarusian: Значыць, ад Мааньяны?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Yes. Now's your chance to *establis..."
links.english: Yes. Now's your chance to *establish contact*.
links.polish: Tak. To twoja szansa na *nawiązanie kontaktu*.
links.belarusian: Так. Гэта твой шанец на *встанаўленне кантакту*.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "But be easy about it. Communists ha..."
links.english: But be easy about it. Communists have been known to charge when startled.
links.polish: Ale zrób to z wyczuciem. Komuniści znani są z tego, że zaskoczeni przypuszczają atak.
links.belarusian: Але зрабі гэта з пачуццём. Камуністы вядомыя тым, што, будучы заспетымі знянацку, яны нападаюць.

links.title: You: "You mean from the skinny guy in the..."
links.english: You mean from the skinny guy in the red hat?
links.polish: Znaczy się, od tego chudego w czerwonej czapce?
links.belarusian: Гэта значыць, ад таго худога ў чырвонай шапцы?

links.title: You: "I don't smell anything."
links.english: I don't smell anything.
links.polish: Nic nie czuję.
links.belarusian: Нічога не адчуваю.
